lines.text: The quickest way to end a miracle is to ask it why it is... or what it wants.
It's old and depressing!
It's reality!
This is the '80s! Nobody likes reality any more.
Batteries not included.
And to think I've been telling my friends it's so cool living with an artist. You never once asked to paint me nude!

Frank! It's the love boat to Cuba! Shuffle board and pineapples filled with rum. Know what they do? They put little paper umbrellas sticking out the top so that when it rains, it don't thin out the liquor.
What ever happened to General Eisenhower? You hardly read a word about him anymore.
Where's the goddam toaster?
Maybe this is all a dream.
Well, if this is a dream which one of us is having it?
Hey, don't look at me. I stopped dreaming a long time ago.
Say 'ah.'
No. Muriel and I say 'frohhg.'
Okay, say 'frohhh.'
I'm a grandmother.
Is this what you're talking about? It's full'o junk. It's a storage shed, you idiot.
No it's not. It's full of ghosts or spirits or something and they're just trying to make me look bad!
You don't need ghosts for that.
Someone was in my room.
Yeah mine too. I think we got elves.

[a construction worker is driving a demolition machine towards the cafe]
Hey! You ever hear of private property?
Just coming for a hamburger, Pop.
Hah! You got alotta nerve. Get your food somewheres else.

[seeing a floating tray of hamburgers]
What the hell is that?
Oh it's them. The little guys. My little munchkins.
You stay away from me! You're not fooling anybody! Crazy my ass!
Where'd you get a new picture?
It's not new. It's fixed.
Fixed like new?
They did a good job.
Who did?
I ain't saying.
GOD DAMMIT, FAYE!
Why am I paying a demolition crew to sit around eating in a restaurant they're supposed to be knocking down?
Hey Frank, guess what I did.
What now?
I named those little guys. Flotsam and Jetsam, isn't that cute?
Yeah cute.
Be nice, Papa.
I'm always nice.

[to Construction Worker]
You wanna sleep over? Why don't you call your mommy and tell her where you'll be.
Um, no thanks, Mrs. Riley, I can't tonight.

[to Carlos]
Hey Bobby, wanna go out and play?
Bobby!
Hey, Lady, my name's not Bobby!
Well excuse me! Robert. Um...
Shut up!
Hey!
Okay, I saw downstairs. Who's been cleaning up after me?
We bring good things to life!

[after having money thrown in his face]
You kill my head, man.

[before punching Carlos out the Door]
I'll take door Number 1.
Got the place back in Business, Pops?
What's it look like?

[to the robotic things]
Welcome to America!
